籤詩版本二:
Lin Weiyihu is at the door
It must be powerful and not harmful to others
It's clear that it's nothing to worry about
worry, hesitation, fear

Forest → wood.
詩意: In this hexagram, forest trees and tigers have a powerful image. All false alarms are less real.
解曰: The stove lights the snow. It's like the wind has fallen on deaf ears. It can be a blessing. Good things come next and bad things happen before them.
籤詩故事一:
◇Pang Hong is afraid of Bao Gong
Renzong of the Song Dynasty. Bao Gong is the governor of Kaifeng Prefecture (official name, equivalent to the prefect). Pang Hong was the father-in-law (the emperor's son-in-law) and imprisoned General Di Qing. When Bao Gong asked for a trial on the case, Pang Hong was frightened and blocked it in many ways. Later, the case came to light and Pang Hong's false accusation was confirmed. He was submitted to the imperial edict of Emperor Renzong of the Song Dynasty and was released because of his relatives.
聖意:
The house is uneasy.
Self tongue.
Seeking wealth, villain.
The transaction is unfavorable.
Marriage is not compatible.
Liujia: False danger.
Pedestrians block.
Field silkworms are damaged.


Six animals are damaged.
Looking for people.
Litigation loss.
Migration. Conservatism.
Lost things are bad.
Disease: Sacrifice the tiger.
Mountain tomb is bad.
